message:
SYSTEM: Wiki: Ir a LinkedData
BioPortal
We have a BioPortal VM available, that can be used to store ontologies and vocabularies. Features include:
Querying and searching by terms
Browsing ontology terms
REST APIs
Adding comments(ontology fixes) and mappings
Ontology versioning
However there is a problem deploying the BioPortal VM: sometimes the web app crashes when browsing the ontology tree (in which case tomcat needs to be restarted)
We have a VM at:
linkeddata2.dia.fi.upm.es: Launch VMWare Player. Run the ncbo-appliance-0.3.vmx VM.
assume the VM IP address is "VM_IP:9090". You canf ind out with >ifconfig.
Enter the bioPortal main site at:
http://VM_IP:9090
from there you will be able to search, browse, and manage the ontologies. Be careful when browsing, if the ontology is too complex it may crash when you navigate the tree!
REVISAR, da error page not found. cambiar puerto a 9090
To enter the bioportal admin tasks:
http://VM_IP:8080/bioportal_admin
. From there you can delete ontologies, change versions, parse unparsed ontologies, etc.
More details and instructions can be found at the bioportal wiki:
http://www.bioontology.org/wiki/index.php/NCBO_FAQ
REVISAR, da error page not found. cambiar puerto a 9090
For the REST API, all services are at
http://VM_IP:8080/bioportal
. See the wiki for details:
http://www.bioontology.org/wiki/index.php/BioPortal_REST_services
if something goes wrong, you can restart all services  with: >ncborestart
Note: The VM is in ova format. With VMPlayer there is no need to convert to vmx, it can load the ova file without any problem
NEW: new VM version available at:
http://www.bioontology.org/ncbo-appliance/ncbo-appliance-0.4.zip
Modified NAT port in file /etc/vmware/vmnet8/nat/nat.conf
Added line 9090=192.168.114.128:80
Repositorio ontologías administración pública

Catálogo de conjuntos de datos

http://vocab.deri.ie/dcat

Most commonly used ontologies
Below are some of most commonly used vocabularies, especially in the context of CRTM and Zaragoza projects:
dcat
schema.org
foaf
rdfs
skos
cpsv
vcard
geo
locn
